summary: Guido Tomme studied chemical engineering  at the University of Ghent, Belgium. In 1989 he joined Bayer Antwerpen N.V., Belgium, where he worked as technical manager in the rubber chemicals and later on in the polymers production. He subsequently transferred to the engineering department where he took the assignment as project manager for the expansion of the Bisphenol A plant in Antwerpen. In 2000 he became plant manager, responsible for production and technology, for the newly to be erected Bisphenol A plant in Map Ta Phut, Thailand, where he stayed till stable operation of the plant.  Tomme subsequently served as site lead for Polycarbonates in Shanghai, China where he planned & erected, started and operated a 200 kton per year polycarbonate facility with raw material production, a primary polycarbonate production as well as a compounding . In 2008 he returned to Europe to take over the global responsibility for the early phases of all Bayer Material Science (now Covestro) projects above 10 Mio€. After developing and implementing a project as project manager for the raw material and infrastructure supply around the new TDI-Production in Dormagen, he was assigned as lead of the group master planning for the polyurethanes business of Bayer, supporting the head of the business unit polyurethanes in decisions around the strategic asset alignment.  In 2011 he was appointed as global head for the unit Civil, Structural & Architectural within the engineering division of Bayer Technology Services.
